title: Statistics-Based Predictive Modeling for Success in Pharmacy Education Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Statistics and Foundational Pharmaceutical Knowledge
context.additional_context: Practice-centered course predicting success factors of a pharmacy education program using regression analysis techniques. Composed of microlearning modules utilizing mobile apps in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Using a regression analysis model, learners can analyze the correlation between academic performance in pharmaceutical education programs and prerequisite course grades.
Learners can explain how to calculate the likelihood of success by academic year in pharmaceutical programs (BSP/PharmD) through statistical predictive modeling.
Learners can quantify the impact of various independent variables (demographic factors, prerequisite course grades) on the dependent variable (program success).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
